The replacement is more about streamlining operations at Google.`` Larry Page , Sergey Brin , and I spent a lot of time talking about how to run everything,'' Eric Schmidt said during the call. After a long series of conversations, we decided to make some changes in the way we are structured and the way we operate things. Historically, we've always been running the decisions together, and ultimately, it adds delay. This is exactly the opposite of how Larry Page described their respective roles in a href="http://googlesystem.blogspot.com/2011/01/googles-new-ceo-Larry Page-Larry Page.html"> 2004 SEC filing, when such collaboration helped`` facilitate timely decisions'' rather than cause`` delay'':
